snippet: Richard J. Lipsky, one of eight people charged in a broad corruption case that led to the arrest former State Senator Carl Kruger, faces up to 10 years in prison.
abstract: Lobbyist Richard J Lipsky, one of eight people charged in a broad corruption case that led to the arrest of former State Senator Carl Kruger, pleads guilty to bribery and conspiracy; he faces up to 10 years in prison if convicted of paying bribes in return for official actions benefiting his clients.
lead_paragraph: Richard J. Lipsky, one of eight people charged in a broad corruption case that led to the arrest former State Senator Carl Kruger, faces up to 10 years in prison.

headline.seo: Lobbyist Richard J. Lipsky Pleads Guilty to Bribery
headline.main: Lobbyist Pleads Guilty to Paying Bribes to a State Senator
headline.print_headline: Lobbyist Pleads Guilty to Paying Bribes to a State Senator
